metadata.synopsis: When French drug kingpin Philippe Douvier (Robert Webber) learns that he's losing the respect of New York mob bosses, he decides to murder Chief Inspector Jacques Clouseau (Peter Sellers) to regain his reputation. After a case of mistaken identity, Clouseau is declared dead, much to the delight of his former boss, Charles Dreyfus (Herbert Lom). When Clouseau reemerges, he teams up with Douvier's ex-lover, Simone LeGree (Dyan Cannon), to break up the drug trafficking operation.

reviews: What fun it would be to see all those involved - including perhaps the durable Clouseau character - try something from scratch.
Okay, but not the best in the series.
Sellers' off-screen brutishness really registers this time
...both Sellers and the series looked tired. But even second-rate Sellers is better than no Sellers at all.

Some people say that the Pink Panther films just got more ridiculous as they went along. Well, so be it. This movie proves that inflatable parrots are just as funny as dead ones. A classic and sadly the last real Closeau film. Recommended.
